name: tram track construction | tram track | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7606/documentation

The dataset represents a tram track construction and its disposal. A double track concrete stretch (width=6.5m) and a bitumen layer of 3 cm on top are accounted. The life span is estimated at 15 years. The dataset of energy use and combustion emissions represents the operation and maintenance of one tram track. The dataset is limited to the energy consumption and land use.

The datasets starts with the material consumption (concrete, bitumen and gravel). The dataset of energy use and combustion emissions starts with the electricity consumption for signals.

The dataset ends with a tram track construction and its disposal. The dataset includes the material consumption (concrete, bitumen and gravel), diesel consumption, the construction process (excavation), the steel and the reinforcing steel consumption and until and including the NMVOC emissions. The dataset of energy use and combustion emissions ends with the operation and maintenance of one tram track. The dataset includes the electricity consumption and until and including the land use (land occupation and transformation). The dataset does not include the material consumption for the operation and maintenance.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/421:Construction of roads and railways/4210:Construction of roads and railways

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Tramway length is based on current statistical data (2000). The material consumption represents a situation in the early 1990ties. For the energy use and combustion emissions, the tram track length is based on current statistical data (2000).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data refers to average conditions in Switzerland. The data of the energy use and combustion emissions refers to average conditions in Switzerland. For de icing activities, a recent Austrian has been applied.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The module track construction and renewal accounts for double track concrete stretch (width = 6.5m) and a bitumen layer of 3 cm on top Maibach et al. (1999). In addition, steel expenditures for railway tracks and bracing are included. Alternative constructions of tram-infrastructure (e.g. green stretches) are not accounted for. The life span is estimated at 15 years. The inventory of the energy use and combustion emissions for operation and maintenance of tram infrastructure is limited to the energy consumption for signals (79.5 kWh/m*a) and land use. For the operation of signals a electricity consumption of 79.5 kWh/m*a is accounted for Maibach et al. (1999). ;;References:;Maibach M., Peter D. and Seiler B. (1999) Ökoinventar Transporte: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Transportsystemen und den Einbezug von Transportsystemen in Ökobilanzen. Technischer Schlussbericht. In: Schweizerischer Nationalfonds zur Förderung der wissenschaftlichen Forschung (ed. SPP Umwelt M.). 2nd Edition. ;Maibach M., Peter D. and Seiler B. (1999) Ökoinventar Transporte: Grundlagen für den ökologischen Vergleich von Transportsystemen und den Einbezug von Transportsystemen in Ökobilanzen. Technischer Schlussbericht. In: Schweizerischer Nationalfonds zur Förderung der wissenschaftlichen Forschung (ed. SPP Umwelt M.). 2nd Edition.
